alternatives.transcript: are there unusual situation within our own federal government the Department of Health and Human Services tries to discourage people from smoking and yet on the other hand our Department of Agriculture subsidizes tobacco growing what's the situation what's happening I think there's a couple of points isn't I'm not sure how you define the term subsidy if you define it like I used to define it then it's

an accuracy to call The Tobacco program or subsidy and secondly you're asking if there's a conflict between the two programs and I think if you look at what the agricultural program that the government runs does that there is no conflict can we get into a little further because it's complex there's some detail there that isn't what the public usually hears about the government runs a price support program that operates much for tobacco like it does for 12 other agricultural Commodities in this country the purpose of the program is to keep the price of tobacco

oh hi and help farmers stay in business to set a minimum price for their crop it's based on a system of loans in the case of tobacco that program has been more successful than any of the other agricultural programs are being run very little money has been lost in those loans where in some of the other crops like corn or wheat or soybeans they may have lost hundreds of millions of dollars a year

and the end result of that program is to have less tobacco grown in this country to keep the price higher than it would be otherwise and what I hear people saying often is they think the tobacco subsidy is something where the government is paying Farmers to grow more tobacco that's simply not the case and in fact those people who've been involved in the government programs to discourage smoking of said that this agricultural program the government runs has nothing to do with encouraging people to smoke if anything it keeps the price of cigarettes higher and maybe that discourages

people we are going to be spending two hours this evening talking about some very complex issues all concerning smoking and it affects all of us there's no doubt about it whether you yourself are a smoker or not you certainly know people that are smokers you probably know people who have had some health effects which they attribute to smoking joining us this evening we're going to be talking with two guests for about a half an hour and then at 9:30 East Coast time we're going to open our telephone lines and let you talk to these two people who have very different ideas on smoking argh
